snippet: Roger Logan, found guilty in a 1997 killing, was freed on Tuesday, the result of his own plea for justice and a review of 90 cases by the Brooklyn district attorney’s office.
abstract: Roger Logan, found guilty in a 1997 killing, is freed from prison, result of his own plea for justice and a review by office of Brooklyn District Atty Kenneth P Thompson; Logan's is one of 90 murder convictions that Thompson and his office are examining, which include not only 57 cases involving Louis Scarcella, retired detective whose methods are under attack, but also dozens of others.
lead_paragraph: Roger Logan, found guilty in a 1997 killing, was freed on Tuesday, the result of his own plea for justice and a review of 90 cases by the Brooklyn district attorney’s office.

headline.seo: In Brooklyn, Scarcella’s Cases Continue to Face Review
headline.main: Another Man Freed as Brooklyn District Attorney’s Office Reviews Cases
headline.print_headline: Another Man Freed as Brooklyn District Attorney’s Office Reviews Cases
